How can I check this? Because i'm a little confused right now. I need to us=
e URLClassLoader to load classes from projects I want my plugin to monitor =
(or is there by any chance much better way i didn't think of?) - the first =
URL in the constructor points at monitored project output directory. But wi=
thout the second URL classes were loaded without @Test annotations. While d=
ebugging i discovered exception 

com.sun.jdi.ClassNotLoadedException: Type=
 has not been loaded occurred while retrieving component type of array. 

w=
hile trying to preview method's annotations. So i added another URL which p=
oints at JUnit jar from Eclipse. Annotations appeared but i'm not 100% sure=
 why it worked.

However,  I just run some tests and it seems, that:

clazz=
Loader.loadClass("org.junit.Test").equals(Test.class)

evaluates to false..=
. I don't know what to do - is there any way i could decorate JUnitCore wit=
h my URLClassLoader? Because as far as i know (and i've spent some time goo=
gling for it) using URLClassLoader is the only sensible way to dynamically =
load classes from class files...  

Thanks for your reply Gilles and once a=
gain, i'd be very grateful for any more help.

Best regards,
Michal Olejnik=


PS. Forgive me if my english is bad, but i've been fighting with this for=
 whole day and i'm just too tired to pay much attention to grammar and spel=
ling. However i hope what i wrote is not very hard to understand
